text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The private sector should recruit more Bahrainis to cut down on the amount of money remitted outside the country, labour and social affairs minister says.
- The Bahrain Monetary Agency urges Bahrain's banks not to raise interest on loans or deposits without justification.
- Arab Banking Corporation decides not to pay dividend to shareholders for 1996 for the second year running.
- Bahrain foreign trade rises to more than three billion dinars in 1996.
- A Bahraini-Egyptian committee plans to launch a new shipping route between the two countries.
